title: Controversial US Influencer Gifts Donald Trump  A Tesla Cybertruck
content: The gifts, valued at over $60,000, may pose legal challenges for Trump due to exceeding federal campaign contribution limits.

title: India's Big Diplomatic Dilemma After Dhaka Shift, Sheikh Hasina's Ouster

title: 22-Year-Old Army Officer Crowned Miss USA After Months Of Pageant Controversy

title: UK Wants UN Probe Into Bangladesh Turmoil, Skirts Sheikh Hasina Asylum
content: The British government has called for a United Nations-led probe into the turmoil that saw Sheikh Hasina resign as the Bangladesh prime minister and flee the country yesterday.
summary: The British government has called for a United Nations-led probe into the turmoil that saw Sheikh Hasina resign as the Bangladesh prime minister and flee the country yesterday.

title: Mujibur Rahman's Rise To Sheikh Hasina's Fall: A Bangladesh Timeline
content: Ex-prime minister Sheikh Hasina's dramatic flight from Bangladesh in a helicopter on Monday under pressure from protesters and the army is far from a first in the South Asian nation.
summary: Ex-prime minister Sheikh Hasina's dramatic flight from Bangladesh in a helicopter on Monday under pressure from protesters and the army is far from a first in the South Asian nation.

title: What Exiled Author Taslima Nasreen Said After Sheikh Hasina Fled Bangladesh
content: Exiled Bangladeshi author Taslima Nasreen, a staunch critic of communalism, has highlighted an irony in the resignation of Sheikh Hasina as the Bangladesh Prime Minister.

title: Joe Biden Holds 'Around-The-Clock' Crisis Talks To Avoid Israel-Iran War
content: US President Joe Biden held crisis talks on Monday on a potential Iranian counterattack on Israel as his administration said it was working around the clock to avoid all-out war in the Middle East.
summary: US President Joe Biden held crisis talks on Monday on a potential Iranian counterattack on Israel as his administration said it was working around the clock to avoid all-out war in the Middle East.

title: Bangladesh Unrest: US Says Interim Government Should Be Made With...
content: The Biden Administration has said an interim government in Bangladesh, which has descended into chaos after the sudden resignation of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina amid violent anti-quota protests, should be formed according to democratic principles.
summary: The Biden Administration has said an interim government in Bangladesh, which has descended into chaos after the sudden resignation of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina amid violent anti-quota protests, should be formed according to democratic principles.

title: Iran Vows "Crushing Response" Against Israel After Hamas Chief's Killing
content: Iran has vowed to take "decisive" action against the "aggressor" behind the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran, accusing Israel of carrying out a "cowardly" attack.
summary: Iran has vowed to take "decisive" action against the "aggressor" behind the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran, accusing Israel of carrying out a "cowardly" attack.

title: Multiple US Soldiers Injured In Rocket Attack On Iraq Base
content: A rocket attack on a base in Iraq wounded multiple US personnel on Monday, officials said, adding to already heightened regional tensions over an expected Iranian counterattack on Israel.
summary: A rocket attack on a base in Iraq wounded multiple US personnel on Monday, officials said, adding to already heightened regional tensions over an expected Iranian counterattack on Israel.

title: 4 Injured After Shooting In US' Seattle: Cops
content: At least four people were injured following a shooting in Seattle, US state of Washington, police said.

title: 2 Hezbollah Fighters Among Three Dead In Israeli Strikes On Lebanon
content: Lebanon's health ministry said Israeli strikes killed three people Monday in the country's south, with Hezbollah announcing the death of two of its fighters and a rescue group mourning a paramedic.
summary: Lebanon's health ministry said Israeli strikes killed three people Monday in the country's south, with Hezbollah announcing the death of two of its fighters and a rescue group mourning a paramedic.

title: Protesters Set Ex-Bangladesh Cricketer Mashrafe Mortaza's House On Fire
content: Protesters have reportedly set on fire the house of former Bangladesh cricket captain Mashrafe Bin Mortaza as violence and chaos continued in the country after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and left the nation on Monday.
summary: Protesters have reportedly set on fire the house of former Bangladesh cricket captain Mashrafe Bin Mortaza as violence and chaos continued in the country after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and left the nation on Monday.

title: "Google Is A Monopolist": US Judge In Landmark Anti-Trust Ruling
content: Alphabet's Google broke the law to cement its dominance over online searches and related ads, a federal judge ruled on Monday in the U.S. Justice Department's first victory against a monopoly in more than 20 years.
summary: Alphabet's Google broke the law to cement its dominance over online searches and related ads, a federal judge ruled on Monday in the U.S. Justice Department's first victory against a monopoly in more than 20 years.

title: US Supreme Court Declines To Halt Trump's Sentencing In Hush Money Case
content: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to halt Donald Trump's upcoming sentencing for his conviction in state court in New York on felony charges involving hush money paid to a porn star and a related gag order until after the Nov. 5 election.
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to halt Donald Trump's upcoming sentencing for his conviction in state court in New York on felony charges involving hush money paid to a porn star and a related gag order until after the Nov. 5 election.

title: "She Didn't Want To Leave, We Insisted": Sheikh Hasina's Son To NDTV
content: Sheikh Hasina, who resigned as Bangladesh's prime minister and fled the country on Monday following weeks of protests, did not want to leave at all but did so on the family's insistence, his US-based son told NDTV.
summary: Sheikh Hasina, who resigned as Bangladesh's prime minister and fled the country on Monday following weeks of protests, did not want to leave at all but did so on the family's insistence, his US-based son told NDTV.

title: Virginia Man Charged With Threatening Vice President Kamala Harris
content: A Virginia man was charged with making violent online threats against Vice President Kamala Harris days after she began her US presidential campaign.
summary: A Virginia man was charged with making violent online threats against Vice President Kamala Harris days after she began her US presidential campaign.

title: Kamala Harris' Vice President Pick Down To Josh Shapiro, Tim Walz: Report
content: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris has narrowed her search for a vice presidential running mate to two finalists, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro and Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, three sources with knowledge of the matter said.
summary: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris has narrowed her search for a vice presidential running mate to two finalists, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro and Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, three sources with knowledge of the matter said.

title: Bodies of 80 Palestinians Handed Over by Israel, Buried in Mass Grave
content: Gaza's Civil Defence agency said it received the bodies of 80 unidentified Palestinians from Israel on Monday, which it buried in a mass grave.
summary: Gaza's Civil Defence agency said it received the bodies of 80 unidentified Palestinians from Israel on Monday, which it buried in a mass grave.

title: Cocaine Worth $1 Million Washed Up On Florida Shore During Hurricane Debby
content: Hurricane Debby landed in Florida Monday bringing high winds, pouring rain -- and 25 tightly wrapped packages of cocaine worth more than $1 million.
summary: Hurricane Debby landed in Florida Monday bringing high winds, pouring rain -- and 25 tightly wrapped packages of cocaine worth more than $1 million.
